Title: Great Camera
Cons: lens cover does not have a strap.
Pros:
Quick auto focus. 
Nice kit lens.
Easy enough to use in automatic with good results and robust enough to learn more advanced options.
Comments: Its my first dslr which was an upgrade from my prosumer vr1 sony 5mp. Great improvement.  I should have not waited so long to make the switch to dslrs.

Title: Awesome
Cons: None whatsoever.
Pros:
Read up a lot on this product and decided to check up on different stores. Newegg had the best price of all and free shipping! 

Ordered the camera and received it within 3 days of my purchase date.

Title: Sweeeeeeet
Cons: i havent had any yet
Pros:
This is a very very good entry-level professional camera. DSLR is the way to go!

one thing of note: the white balance in this camera is very good :)

Title: Great for Student Journalist/Photography
Cons: Only two I can think of is the strap it came with, fairly uncomfortable. I made a few modifications, and now It's a sling. The other is that the kit lense does not let in much light, but I knew this beforehand. I plan on spending a few hundred to upgrade the lens by this summer.
Pros: Great image quality! I've had this camera since early January, and ever since, I haven't stopped taking pictures! It's fairly light, and easy to use.
Comments: If you are starting out as a photo journalist, or are a photography student. I highly recommend this camera, for it's ease of use, and How much you get for so little cash.

Cons: None. Camera has worked perfectly.
Pros: Very good camera for the price. Takes amazing pictures on the stock lens kit.
Comments: This is a great DSLR for anyone who is just starting out. It comes with tons of literature on photography and after spending about an hour with the manual, I was taking amazing pictures. I don't see any need to upgrade the camera body beyond this one anytime soon, thought I do recommend getting a few lenses after a couple of weeks with the camera.

Title: Great First DSLR
Cons: None at this time.
Pros: This a great budget DSLR!  Takes great pictures in full auto mode and in manual modes if you take the time to learn how to use it.  Seeing what this camera can do makes me want to add lenses to further its capabilities.

Title: Terrible Misleading Title
Cons:
Basically ordered this. As advertised it was supposed to come with a W/EF-S 18-55mm F/3.5-5.6 IS Lens. Ordered from newegg. They shipped the camera without the lense.

Then they claimed it doesn't come with a lens. 
After much hassle was able to get  a refund, and  had to fight for a shipping cost refund considering they shipped me  a product I didn't order. I ordered one with a lens and didn't get it.
Pros: The camera itself has alot of pros as other people has said. The cons however, i have to explain
Comments: Would I order this from newegg again? No. Find someplace else.

Title: Exceptional camera for the price!
Cons: As expected, the XSi may lack a some features of more expensive DSLRs, but is quite well equipped for an entry level camera of this type. It would be nice if the 3" LCD screen were higher resolution.
Pros: When used with good quality glass and in the right hands, this camera can take images of exceptional quality. The kit lens included suffers from some of the shortcomings of less expensive lenses; however, is very sharp and functions surprisingly well. This camera is light, smaller and very easy to use.

Title: haha i love this thing
Cons: I have huge hands... so the grip is kinda funky...
Pros:
I dont think you guys would believe me if i said i got this brand spanking new for 420 bucks... but w/e

great picture quality
12.2mp great for cropping...
not too much noise if you know what youre doing
live view - i dont plan on using it
9AF points
easy to use menu

very nice pics can be taken with this camera...
youve just gotta know what youre doing i guess...
Comments:
Get a fast memory card to complement this bad boy... i got a san disk extreme or something like that :)

Get this over the xs IF YOU CAN...

Title: Best digital picture I've seen.
Cons: Not sure how these features compare to other cameras in this price range, but there is no video taking mode on this camera.  Also, the 3" screen does only shows settings for the automatic picture taking modes--you'll have to look through the viewfinder to take pictures.
Pros: Bought one of these because my brother-in-law has a similar but slight older model.  The crisp pictures are great without any of the blur that you get from the typical digital camera.  Fairly intuitive use with a nice setting for the fullest of automatic picture taking.  Yet other modes allow the fullest of control..

Cons: Not sure how these features compare to other cameras in this price range, but there is no video taking mode on this camera.  Also, the 3" screen does only shows settings for the automatic picture taking modes--you'll have to look through the viewfinder to take pictures.
Pros: Bought one of these because my brother-in-law has a similar but slight older model.  The crisp pictures are great without any of the blur that you get from the typical digital camera.  Fairly intuitive use with a nice setting for the fullest of automatic picture taking.  Yet other modes allow the fullest of control..

Title: Great Camera
Cons: lens cover does not have a strap.
Pros:
Quick auto focus. 
Nice kit lens.
Easy enough to use in automatic with good results and robust enough to learn more advanced options.
Comments: Its my first dslr which was an upgrade from my prosumer vr1 sony 5mp. Great improvement.  I should have not waited so long to make the switch to dslrs.

Title: Awesome
Cons: None whatsoever.
Pros:
Read up a lot on this product and decided to check up on different stores. Newegg had the best price of all and free shipping! 

Ordered the camera and received it within 3 days of my purchase date.

Title: Sweeeeeeet
Cons: i havent had any yet
Pros:
This is a very very good entry-level professional camera. DSLR is the way to go!

one thing of note: the white balance in this camera is very good :)

Title: Great for Student Journalist/Photography
Cons: Only two I can think of is the strap it came with, fairly uncomfortable. I made a few modifications, and now It's a sling. The other is that the kit lense does not let in much light, but I knew this beforehand. I plan on spending a few hundred to upgrade the lens by this summer.
Pros: Great image quality! I've had this camera since early January, and ever since, I haven't stopped taking pictures! It's fairly light, and easy to use.
Comments: If you are starting out as a photo journalist, or are a photography student. I highly recommend this camera, for it's ease of use, and How much you get for so little cash.

Cons: None. Camera has worked perfectly.
Pros: Very good camera for the price. Takes amazing pictures on the stock lens kit.
Comments: This is a great DSLR for anyone who is just starting out. It comes with tons of literature on photography and after spending about an hour with the manual, I was taking amazing pictures. I don't see any need to upgrade the camera body beyond this one anytime soon, thought I do recommend getting a few lenses after a couple of weeks with the camera.

Title: Great First DSLR
Cons: None at this time.
Pros: This a great budget DSLR!  Takes great pictures in full auto mode and in manual modes if you take the time to learn how to use it.  Seeing what this camera can do makes me want to add lenses to further its capabilities.

Title: Terrible Misleading Title
Cons:
Basically ordered this. As advertised it was supposed to come with a W/EF-S 18-55mm F/3.5-5.6 IS Lens. Ordered from newegg. They shipped the camera without the lense.

Then they claimed it doesn't come with a lens. 
After much hassle was able to get  a refund, and  had to fight for a shipping cost refund considering they shipped me  a product I didn't order. I ordered one with a lens and didn't get it.
Pros: The camera itself has alot of pros as other people has said. The cons however, i have to explain
Comments: Would I order this from newegg again? No. Find someplace else.

Title: Exceptional camera for the price!
Cons: As expected, the XSi may lack a some features of more expensive DSLRs, but is quite well equipped for an entry level camera of this type. It would be nice if the 3" LCD screen were higher resolution.
Pros: When used with good quality glass and in the right hands, this camera can take images of exceptional quality. The kit lens included suffers from some of the shortcomings of less expensive lenses; however, is very sharp and functions surprisingly well. This camera is light, smaller and very easy to use.

Title: haha i love this thing
Cons: I have huge hands... so the grip is kinda funky...
Pros:
I dont think you guys would believe me if i said i got this brand spanking new for 420 bucks... but w/e

great picture quality
12.2mp great for cropping...
not too much noise if you know what youre doing
live view - i dont plan on using it
9AF points
easy to use menu

very nice pics can be taken with this camera...
youve just gotta know what youre doing i guess...
Comments:
Get a fast memory card to complement this bad boy... i got a san disk extreme or something like that :)

Get this over the xs IF YOU CAN...
